= Components =
(generated)


*Component items*:
  * *Ear - inner hair cells (ear-inner-hair-cells)*: frequency-aligned tonotopic mapping
  * *Ear - outer hair cells feedback (ear-outer-hair-cells-feedback)*: verifies amplify actions done
  * *Ear - cristae and maculae (ear-cristae-maculae)*: activate afferent receptors in response to rotational and linear acceleration
  * *Ear - somatic receptors (ear-somatic)*: from skin to geniculate ganglion to spinal trigeminal nucleus
  * *Ear - outer ear skin (ear-external-skin)*: skin over the mastoid process, back of the auricle, lobule and a portion of the scalp
  * *Ear - acoustic meatus skin (ear-acoustic-meatus-skin)*: from skin lining external acoustic meatus, and tympanic membrane to trigeminal gangion
  * *Ear - visceral receptors (ear-visceral)*: pain, temperature, and touch
  * *Ear - timpanic cavity (ear-timpanic-cavity)*: pain, temperature, and touch
  * *Ear - outer hair cells (ear-outer-hair-cells)*: mechanically amplify low-level sound that enters cochlea
  * *Ear - stapedius muscle (ear-stapedius)*: dampens vibrations of stapes
  * *Ear - tympanic membrane muscle (ear-tensor-tympani-muscle)*: dampen sounds, such as those produced from chewing
  * *Ear - anterior auricular muscle (ear-anterior-auricular-muscle)*: pulls ear forward
  * *Ear - posterior auricular muscle (ear-posterior-auricular-muscle)*: pulls ear backward
  * *Ear - superior auricular muscle (ear-superior-auricular-muscle)*: pulls ear upward
  * *Ear - oblique muscle of auricle (ear-oblique-auricular-muscle)*: movement of the ears
  * *Ear - temporoparietalis muscle (ear-temporoparietalis-muscle)*: assist the frontal belly in drawing the epicranial aponeurosis towards the front of the cranium
